title: 112_s3531
content: Expansion of credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property. Expansion of credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property by increasing the credit percentage to 50% for hydrogen-related property and removing the dollar limitation for hydrogen-related property. Additionally, the credit is allowable for refueling property for certain motor vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads. Expansion of the credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property includes amending subsection (c) of section 30C to include off-highway vehicles for the storage or dispensing of hydrogen fuel. Subsection (e) defines specified off-highway vehicles. The term 'specified off-highway vehicles' is defined as all motor-propelled vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads, regardless of registration status or type of load. The term 'specified off-highway vehicles' includes vehicles registered for highway use, excluding farm tractors, trench diggers, and vehicles operating exclusively on rails. The credit for hydrogen property has been extended through December 31, 2016. The amendments apply to property placed in service after the enactment date for taxable years ending after that date. The amendment made by this Act applies to hydrogen refueling property placed in service after December 31, 2014. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells, with a 50 percent increase for qualified fuel cell property used in a combined heat and power system with an energy efficiency percentage of 70 percent or more. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells, with a 40 percent increase for qualified fuel cell property used in a system with an energy efficiency percentage of at least 60 percent but less than 70 percent. Conforming amendments are also made to the relevant sections of the Code. The tax code is amended to increase the maximum credit for qualified fuel cell property placed in service during the taxable year. The credit cannot exceed a certain amount for such property. The tax code is amended to increase the maximum credit for qualified fuel cell property placed in service during the taxable year. The credit cannot exceed $2,500 for each 0.5 kilowatt of capacity for certain types of property. The tax code is amended to increase the maximum credit for qualified fuel cell property placed in service. The credit cannot exceed $2,500 for each 0.5 kilowatt of capacity. The amendments apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment of this Act.
